newsitem.title: VIRGIN ISLANDS: U.S. Virgin Islands to add an island.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Virgin Islands to add an island.

text.p: A small island off the capital of the U.S. Virgin Islands was being cleaned up on Tuesday in advance of a ceremony to mark its transfer from the U.S. Army to the territory's government.

Water Island, in the harbour of Charlotte Amalie, the territory's capital, once housed Fort Segarra, the Army's Virgin Islands headquarters. It will become the fourth-largest of the U.S. Virgin Islands but is home to fewer than 2,000 people.

On Dec. 12, 50 of Water Island's 500 acres (200 hectares) will be transferred to the government of the American territory from the U.S. Department of the Interior. Much of the land being transferred is leased by people with titles to property on which they have built houses, and most of the titleholders were to buy the properties from the Interior Department.

Although the U.S. Virgin Islands consist of more than 40 islands and keys, the three principal islands are St. Thomas, St. Croix and St. John. The Virgin Islands are about 70 miles (112 km) east of Puerto Rico and 2,000 miles (3,200 km) southeast of Miami.
